info.name: Voucherify API - Integration Examples
info.description:
Voucherify offers **a business-agnostic API to model any promotion case**. You can start with a single campaign type and expand to other types later. Thanks to modularity, you can choose which building blocks you need at the moment. This way, you can start small and run bigger projects later without large upfront costs.

A pivotal factor for evaluating the total cost of integration is to understand how Voucherify can be connected to your e-commerce and marketing infrastructure that runs your business. There are three angles to consider.

The Integration Examples provided in this collection explain the basic processes required to integrate Voucherify to your system, advances interactions, and industry-specific cases.

item.description:
This section will show you how to create a bulk (unique) coupon code campaign using our APIs only. This will also include creation and assignment of Validation Rules to place parameters on facets of the order that will need to be valid in order for the coupon to be used.

_Note: typically campaigns will be built direclty within the_ [Voucherify dashboard](https://support.voucherify.io/article/46-bulk-unique-codes-campaign)_, but the entire process can be built and managed directly through APIs as well, as will be shown here._

_**Standalone codes are created with the 'Create Voucher' endpoint while Bulk code campaigns are created with the 'Create Campaign' endpoint.**_

---

The bulk (unique) coupon codes will have the following criteria:

- This will be labeled our 'Thank You Campaign'
- 'THANKYOU#####' will be the code pattern
- Available for use only for 30 days after publication
- Eligible only for products under the 'Electronics' category
    - _Note: The 'category' Product Metadata definition will need to have been created in the Dashboard already, and along with that a Dynamic Product Collection 'Electronics' that will include all products where category = Electronics_
- Only the owner of the code may use the code

item.name: Bulk Code Publishing
item.description:
This section will show you how to publish bulk (unique) coupon codes to individual customers using our APIs only. This will assign the code to a customer, ensuring only they can use this unique code if you set up your Validation Rules to limit use of the code to the owner only, as was demonstrated in the Bulk Code Creation section.

_Note: you can set up automatic_ [Distributions](https://support.voucherify.io/article/19-how-does-the-distribution-manager-work) _through the Voucherify dashboard as well, that will publish a code to a customer when they meet criteria you define (such as entering a specific Customer Segment). The route shown here through our APIs is reflective of more of a 'one-time' or 'ad hoc' publishing._

item.description:
This section will show you how to create a standalone (shared) coupon code using our APIs only. This will also include creation and assignment of Validation Rules to place parameters on facets of the order that will need to be valid in order for the coupon to be used.

_Note: typically campaigns will be built direclty within the_ [Voucherify dashboard](https://support.voucherify.io/article/49-fixed-code-campaign)_, but the entire process can be built and managed directly through APIs as well, as will be shown here._

_**Standalone codes are created with the 'Create Voucher' endpoint while Bulk code campaigns are created with the 'Create Campaign' endpoint.**_

---

The standalone (shared) coupon code will have the following criteria:

- 'FLASHSALE' will be the code
- Eligible only for orders $100 or more

This section will cover the API calls needed to build your coupon codes within Voucherify.

It's not mandatory to create campaigns via the API. The campaign and voucher creation is managed via [Voucherify's Dashboard](https://support.voucherify.io/article/16-dashboard-sections). The API requests in this section aim to create the proper data before applying the discounts.

The **Configuration** stage will cover the following:

- Creation of a **Standalone** (shared) coupon code voucher
- Creation of a **Bulk** (unique) coupon code campaign
- Creation of **Validation Rules** to define criteria that must be met in order for the coupon to be used
- **Publishing** unique codes to assign them to individual customers in the case of a **Bulk** (unique) coupon code campaign

This may be a combination of unique codes that were assigned to them individually, and shared standalone codes they are elgiible to use based on who they are, what they are browsing, or what is in their cart.

item.name: Redeeming Selected Coupon(s)
item.description:
This section will show the API calls to make to complete redemption of the coupon(s) your customer has entered to use, once their order is processed.

We will show a number of Redemption requests and responses covering:

- Redemption of a single code
- Redemption of multiple codes

This section will cover the API calls needed to support the experience for customers on your website or mobile application once they have received the codes they would like to use, that were created in the previous **Configuration** section. The **Customer Experience** stage will cover the following:

- **Presenting** all coupon codes at checkout to a customer that they are eligible to use based on the context of themselves and their order
- **Validating** coupon codes at checkout once the customer has selected the code(s) they wish to use
- **Redeeming** the coupon code(s) once the customer has submitted their order

This API collection will walk you through the entire process flow of a voucher (coupon code) in Voucherify.

This collection will include templates for all of the requests you will need to:

- **Create** a coupon code (standalone voucher or bulk code campaign)
    
- **Assign** codes to individual customers
    
- **Present** all coupon codes at checkout to a customer that they are eligible to use based on the context of themselves and their order
    
- **Validate** coupon codes at checkout once the customer has selected the code(s) they wish to use
    
- **Redeem** the coupon code(s) once the customer submitted their order
    

The complete process is described in the [Integration Processes guide](https://docs.voucherify.io/docs/integration-processes#redeeming-voucher-codes).

item.description:
This section will show you how to create an automatically applied promotion campaign with the API. This will also include creation and assignment of validation rules that will need to be valid in order for the promotion to be used.

It is recommended that campaigns be built directly within the dashboard. However, it can also be done via API.

---

The automatically applied promotion will have the following attributes:

- This promotion internally will be called 'Promotion for Subscribers'
- The promotion will consist of two tiers and will only be available to subscribed users
    
- The customer will see it as '10% OFF for spending at least 50$' or '20% OFF for spending at least 250$'.
- Available for use from February 27, 2024 to February 27, 2025

This section covers the API calls needed to generate coupon codes and promotions within Voucherify.

Creating campaigns via the API is not mandatory  this process can be managed via the [Dashboard](https://support.voucherify.io/article/16-dashboard-sections).

The **Configuration** stage covers the following:

- Creation of a **Standalone** (generic) coupon code.
- Creation of a **Bulk** (unique) coupon code campaign.
- Creation of **Validation Rules** to define criteria that must be met for the coupon to be used.
- **Publishing** unique codes to assign them to individual customers.
- Creation of a **Promotion Campaign.**
- Creation of **Validation Rules** to define criteria that must be met in order for the promotion to be used and **Assigning** it to the promotion campaign.

This section shows how to redeem the coupon(s) and/or promotion(s) your customer intends to use.

This section shows sample redemption request and response.

This section covers the API calls needed to support the best customer experience on your website or mobile application. This section covers the following:

- **Presenting** all coupon codes or promotions at checkout to a customer that they are eligible for based on the shopping context.
- **Validating** a coupon code or a promotion at checkout once the customer has selected the code(s) they wish to use.
- **Redeeming** a coupon code(s) or promotion(s) once the customer has submitted their order.

**This API collection will walk you through the entire voucher (promo code) and promotion lifecycle.**

Unlike coupon codes, automatic promotions do not require codes to be entered, and will be automatically applied at checkout for eligible orders.

This collection includes templates for all requests to:

- **Create** a coupon code (standalone voucher or bulk code campaign) or an automatically applied promotion campaign.
- **Assign** a code to an individual customer.
- **Present** all coupon codes or promotions at checkout to a customer that they are eligible for based on the shopping context.
- **Validate** a coupon code or a promotion at checkout once the customer has selected the incentives they wish to use.
- **Redeem** a coupon code(s) or a promotion(s) once the customer has submitted their order.
    

The complete process is described in the [Integration Processes guide](https://docs.voucherify.io/docs/integration-processes#redeeming-voucher-codes).

item.name: Order Creation
item.description:
This section shows how to create an order with a paid status.

The orders are created automatically during the redemption process. However, if you wish to track all the orders that are not connected to any discounts, you can track the order in Voucherify.

Tracking the order in Voucherify enables segmenting the customer based on the previous orders, reward the customers with points for making purchases, and allows to setup automatic distributions based on the paid orders.

item.description:
This section shows how to redeem the coupon(s) and/or promotion(s) your customer intends to use.

This section shows sample redemption request and response.

This section covers the API calls needed to support the best customer experience on your website or mobile application. This section covers the following:

- **Presenting** available incentives in the context of customer wallet before and after making a first order.
    
- **Validating** a code received from a loyalty campaign
    
- **Redeeming** a code received from a loyalty campaign

**This API collection will walk you through the entire loyalty scenario.**

This collection includes templates for all requests to:

- **Create a** loyalty campaign (auto join).
- **Create** an earning rule (1 point for $1 spent).
    
- **Add** a reward (1 point = 1 cent).
    
- **Present** eligible discounts (none).
    
- **Create** an order with status paid.
    
- **Present** eligible discounts (loyalty campaign code)
    
- **Validation**
    
- **Redemption**
    

The complete process is described in the [Integration Processes guide](https://docs.voucherify.io/docs/integration-processes#rewarding-customers-with-points-for-purchases).

To integrate Voucherify into your system, you need to incorporate Voucherify's API requests and handle the information that is returned in response. Voucherify is a promotion engine designed with both marketers and developers in mind, using an API-first approach. This means that data can be seamlessly exchanged between the Voucherify database and your system database, enabling smooth and real-time synchronization. Typically, the customer journey unfolds through the following key steps: - [Qualification](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/check-eligibility) occasionally, you may want your customers see vouchers, promotions, and campaigns they qualify for, based on customer attributes and the current contents of their shopping cart. Voucherify's Qualifications API suggests relevant promotions and coupons within the specific customer and order context and offers filtering options based on campaign category and hierarchy. - [Publication](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-publication) it involves associating a code with a specific customer. Typically, code distribution occurs through publications to your customers. Once the code is delivered to a customer, it becomes visible in their profile in Voucherify. - [Validation](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/validate-stacked-discounts) it verifies the eligibility of the selected discounts and calculates the final price. - [Redemption](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/redeem-stacked-discounts) it redeems a combination of vouchers, promotion tiers, and promotion stacks. **The described processess applies to any type of discount, regardless of the voucher type or discount effect.**

item.description: In this scenario, the customer buys 25 coffees in one order, meaning they will receive 2 discount coupons after the purchase. Next, they use both codes in the following order.

This section covers the API calls needed to support the best customer experience on your website or mobile application. This section covers the following:

- **Create** order
    
- **List** vouchers
    
- Validate a coupon code
    
- **Redeem** a coupon code
    

In addition, the experience will be divided into two different scenarios.

Scenario 1: In this scenario, the customer buys 5 coffees in each order, meaning they will receive the discount coupon after the second purchase. Next, they use the code in the following order.

Scenario 2: In this scenario, the customer buys 25 coffees in one order, meaning they will receive 2 discount coupons after the purchase. Next, they use both codes in the following order.

This part of the integration will focus on scenario connected with the loyalty campaign and collecting stamps. The campaign will consist of 1 earning rules(customers will get 1 point for every coffee they buy, and 1 reward (after collecting 10 points, customers will get a free coffee).

This collection includes templates for all requests to:

- **Create** 1 campaign that will server as a source for discount voucher reward
    
- **Create** a loyalty campaign
    
- **Create** validation rule and assign them to appropriate campaign
    
- **Create** reward and reward assignment
    

After the configuration process, the customer experience will consist of the following API calls:

- **Create** order
    
- **List** vouchers - we will be able to see all the voucher published from our free coffee campaign
    
- Validate Selected Redeemables
    
- Redeem Selected Redeemables
